intro: Hieracium geilingeri, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium geilingeri is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
